```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(ggplot2)
library(RColorBrewer)
```

```{r}
attach(red_wine)
attach(white_wine)

# for convenience, make shorter variable names:
names(red_wine) <- c("fa","va","ca","rs","chl","fsd","tsd","den","ph","sul","alc","qual")
names(white_wine) <- names(red_wine)

head(white_wine)

red_wine$type <- "red"
white_wine$type <- "white"

wine <- rbind(red_wine,white_wine)
dim(wine)
```

```{r}
# --------- EXPLORATORY DATA ANALYSIS ------------

ggplot(wine, aes(x=fa, fill=type)) +geom_histogram(alpha=0.8,position = "dodge", bins = 15)+
  theme_minimal()+scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Set1")

ggplot(wine, aes(x=va, fill=type)) +geom_histogram(alpha=0.8,position = "dodge", bins = 15)+
  theme_minimal()+scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Set1")


ggplot(wine, aes(x=ca, fill=type)) +geom_histogram(alpha=0.8,position = "identity", bins = 15)+
  theme_minimal()+scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Set1")

# variable 1: fixed acidity (fa)
summary(red_wine$fa)

ggplot(data = red_wine, aes(fa)) + geom_histogram(col='black', fill = 'blue', alpha=0.7, bins=15)+ labs(title = "Histogram of fixed acidity in red wine") + theme_minimal() + theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust=0.5))

qqnorm(red_wine$fa)
qqline(red_wine$fa)


# variable 2: volatile acidity (va)
summary(red_wine$va)

ggplot(data = red_wine, aes(va)) + geom_histogram(col='black', fill = 'blue', alpha=0.7, bins=10)+ labs(title = "Histogram of volatile acidity in red wine") + theme_minimal() + theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust=0.5))

qqnorm(red_wine$va)
qqline(red_wine$va)


# Variable 3: citric acid (ca)
summary(red_wine$ca)

ggplot(data = red_wine, aes(ca)) + geom_histogram(col='black', fill = 'blue', alpha=0.7, bins=15)+ labs(title = "Histogram of citric acid in red wine") + theme_minimal() + theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust=0.5))


# variable 4: residual sugar (rs)
summary(red_wine$rs)

ggplot(data = red_wine, aes(rs)) + geom_histogram(col='black', fill = 'blue', alpha=0.7, bins=10)+ labs(title = "Histogram of residual sugar in red wine") + theme_minimal() + theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust=0.5))

# variable 5: chlorides (chl)
summary(red_wine$chl)

ggplot(data = red_wine, aes(chl)) + geom_histogram(col='black', fill = 'blue', alpha=0.7, bins=10)+ labs(title = "Histogram of citric acid in red wine") + theme_minimal() + theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust=0.5))

# variable 6: free sulfur dioxide (fsd)
summary(red_wine$fsd)

ggplot(data = red_wine, aes(fsd)) + geom_histogram(col='black', fill = 'blue', alpha=0.7, bins=10)+ labs(title = "Histogram of free sulfur acid in red wine") + theme_minimal() + theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust=0.5))

# variable 7: total sulfur dioxide (tsd)
summary(red_wine$tsd)

ggplot(data = red_wine, aes(tsd)) + geom_histogram(col='black', fill = 'blue', alpha=0.7, bins=10)+ labs(title = "Histogram of total sulfur dioxide in red wine") + theme_minimal() + theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust=0.5))

# variable 8: density(den)
summary(red_wine$den)

ggplot(data = red_wine, aes(den)) + geom_histogram(col='black', fill = 'blue', alpha=0.7, bins=10)+ labs(title = "Histogram of density of red wine") + theme_minimal() + theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust=0.5))

# variable 9: pH
summary(red_wine$ph)

ggplot(data = red_wine, aes(ph)) + geom_histogram(col='black', fill = 'blue', alpha=0.7, bins=10)+ labs(title = "Histogram of pH of red wine") + theme_minimal() + theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust=0.5))

# variable 10: sulphates (sul)
summary(red_wine$sul)

ggplot(data = red_wine, aes(sul)) + geom_histogram(col='black', fill = 'blue', alpha=0.7, bins=10)+ labs(title = "Histogram of sulphates in red wine") + theme_minimal() + theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust=0.5))

# variable 11: alcohol (alc)
summary(red_wine$alc)

ggplot(data = red_wine, aes(alc)) + geom_histogram(col='black', fill = 'blue', alpha=0.7, bins=10)+ labs(title = "Histogram of alcohol in red wine") + theme_minimal() + theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust=0.5))

```
